newsitem.title: USA: Alliant wins $108.8-mln tank ammo contract.
newsitem.headline: Alliant wins $108.8-mln tank ammo contract.

text.p: Alliant Techsystems Inc said its defense systems group won a contract valued at $108.8 million to produce 120mm training ammunition for use by the U.S. Army's M1A1/A2 Abrams main battle tank.

The contract which was awarded by the U.S. Army Industrial Operations Command in Rock Island, Ill. It is part of a four-year, $242.3 million basic contract awarded in February 1995 and an $80 million option to that contract awarded in January 1996, Alliant said.
The basic award calls for production of 484,000 training rounds, while the option is for production of up to 155,000 rounds. A portion of the rounds are for sale to U.S. allies.
Production work on the contract will be performed at Alliant's manufacturing facilities in Radford, Va., Toone, Tenn., and Totowa, N.J., Alliant said.
